actions.text: Referred to the House Committee on Government Reform.

actions.subcommittee: Government Efficiency, Financial Management and Intergovernmental Relations
actions.text: Referred to the Subcommittee on Government Efficiency, Financial Management and Intergovernmental Relations.

committees.subcommittee: Subcommittee on Government Efficiency, Financial Management and Intergovernmental Relations

official_title: To prohibit the provision of financial assistance by the Federal Government to any person who is more than 60 days delinquent in the payment of any child support obligation.
short_title: Subsidy Termination for Overdue Payments Act of 2001

summary.text: Subsidy Termination for Overdue Payments Act of 2001 - Prohibits a Federal agency or instrumentality from providing financial assistance unless the applicant provides a certification attesting that the applicant: (1) is not 60 days delinquent in adjudicated child support payments; or (2) if so delinquent, is in compliance with an agreed upon child support payment plan.Exempts from such proscription financial assistance subject to garnishment for failure to pay child support, and certain good cause circumstances.

titles.title: Subsidy Termination for Overdue Payments Act of 2001
To prohibit the provision of financial assistance by the Federal Government to any person who is more than 60 days delinquent in the payment of any child support obligation.
